Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the supernatural element of a ghost directing rescuers to save a trapped baby.
Understate: There is no indication of any understatement in the claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific evidence or support to substantiate the existence of a ghost or the events described.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes the existence of ghosts and their ability to interact with the living.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the events described, such as mistaken identity or hallucinations.
Contradict fact: There is no clear contradiction of established facts in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no clear indication of the claim faltering at any point.
